meanings.sent1: The preflighted plane was ready for takeoff.
meanings.sent2: The pilot always ensures the preflighted aircraft is safe to fly.
meanings.sent3: The preflighted helicopter had no issues, much to the relief of the passengers.
meanings.sent4: Her preflighted parachute gave her a sense of security before skydiving.
meanings.sent5: The preflighted engine hummed smoothly as the plane ascended.

meanings.definition: To prepare for a flight by checking equipment and procedures.
meanings.sent1: Before taking off, the pilot preflighted the plane meticulously.
meanings.sent2: It is important to preflight the aircraft to ensure a safe journey.
meanings.sent3: The pilot preflighted the small plane with great attention to detail.
meanings.sent4: She always preflighted her drone before capturing aerial footage.
meanings.sent5: Preflighting the hot air balloon involved checking the burner for any issues.

meanings.definition: To examine or inspect before flying.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic preflighted the helicopter before the rescue mission.
meanings.sent2: Pilots must preflight the aircraft before every takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut preflighted the spaceship before the interstellar journey.
meanings.sent4: Before the airshow, the stunt pilot preflighted his plane for safety.
meanings.sent5: Preflighting the glider involved checking the wings for any damage.
